nodes.body: I think it does not really matter (as in it won't show up in practice), but mostly I'm not sure how to avoid duplicating the entire `positivity` extension. I know you can make a `positivity` extension trigger on different inputs, but the match inside would still only work for one of them. @hrmacbeth, do you have advice for me here?

I just went along and tried that. There's basically no use of `zero_le_real`/`zero_lt_real` in mathlib and no use of `ofReal_ne_zero` that has `ComplexOrder` open (so `positivity` fails, since it needs a `PartialOrder` instance on every type). The solution to make this more applicable would be to have the `nonzeroness` tactic mentioned at @urkud's Rutgers talk.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8114170023/job/22179196160)
Could you look through the library and replace `ofReal_nonneg` and `ofReal_pos` with `positivity` where possible?

This will *only* apply to the coercion and not to some of the other bundled maps we have, like `Complex.ofReal`. Of course, that's only a `simp` away, but it could be inconvenient. Do you think we should support these other ones directly, or not?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
My status is that I can't make it any better, but I would be very interested in learning how to fix the duplication between `Complex.ofReal'` and `Complex.ofReal`.

This will *only* apply to the coercion and not to some of the other bundled maps we have, like `Complex.ofReal`. Of course, that's only a `simp` away, but it could be inconvenient. Do you think we should support these other ones directly, or not?
I agree with Yael that this should be enough.
Could you look through the library and replace `ofReal_nonneg` and `ofReal_pos` with `positivity` where possible?
My status is that I can't make it any better, but I would be very interested in learning how to fix the duplication between `Complex.ofReal'` and `Complex.ofReal`.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
/-- Extension for the `positivity` tactic: `Complex.ofReal'` is positive/nonnegative/nonzero if its
```
This is a deliberate lie because all lemmas about `Complex.ofReal'` refer to it as `Complex.ofReal`. If you ask me, I think `Complex.ofReal` should be `Complex.ofRealHom` instead.
This shouldn't be a problem anymore
Indeed, I forgot to update it
These should be in the `test` folder.

I don't like that so much. Because of the way `positivity` works, you can test its extensions right away. So, unless you're trying to test something in the core logic of `positivity`, you might as well put the tests next to the extension so that you get instant feedback. This is what I've been doing for all my extensions for a while..

We can implement it for multiple morphisms without quite duplicating everything, like this:
```suggestion
@[positivity Complex.ofReal' _, Complex.ofReal _]
def evalComplexOfReal : PositivityExt where eval {u α} _ _ e := do
  -- TODO: Can we avoid duplicating the code?
  match u, α, e with
  | 0, ~q(ℂ), ~q(Complex.ofReal' $a) =>
    assumeInstancesCommute
    match ← core q(inferInstance) q(inferInstance) a with
    | .positive pa => return .positive q(ofReal_pos $pa)
    | .nonnegative pa => return .nonnegative q(ofReal_nonneg $pa)
    | .nonzero pa => return .nonzero q(ofReal_ne_zero_of_ne_zero $pa)
    | _ => return .none
  | 0, ~q(ℂ), ~q(Complex.ofReal $a) =>
    assumeInstancesCommute
    match ← core q(inferInstance) q(inferInstance) a with
    | .positive pa => return .positive q(ofReal_pos $pa)
    | .nonnegative pa => return .nonnegative q(ofReal_nonneg $pa)
    | .nonzero pa => return .nonzero q(ofReal_ne_zero_of_ne_zero $pa)
    | _ => return .none
  | _, _ => throwError "not Complex.ofReal'"
```

However, I can't figure out how to pull out the duplication into a local definition. It would be something like:
```suggestion
@[positivity (Complex.ofReal' _), (Complex.ofReal _)]
def evalComplexOfReal : PositivityExt where eval {u α} _ _ e := do
  match u, α, e with
  | 0, ~q(ℂ), ~q(Complex.ofReal' $a) => go a ⟨⟩
  | 0, ~q(ℂ), ~q(Complex.ofReal $a) => go a ⟨⟩
  | _, _ => throwError "not Complex.ofReal'"
  where
    go {e} (a : Q(ℝ)) (h : $e =Q ofReal $a) : MetaM (Strictness _ _ e) := do
    match ← core q(inferInstance) q(inferInstance) a with
    | .positive pa => return .positive q(ofReal_pos $pa)
    | .nonnegative pa => return .nonnegative q(ofReal_nonneg $pa)
    | .nonzero pa => return .nonzero q(ofReal_ne_zero_of_ne_zero $pa)
    | _ => return .none
```
I've committed your code with a todo to deduplicate

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `positivity` extension for the coercion `ℝ → ℂ`

nodes.body: This will *only* apply to the coercion and not to some of the other bundled maps we have, like `Complex.ofReal`. Of course, that's only a `simp` away, but it could be inconvenient. Do you think we should support these other ones directly, or not?

I think it does not really matter (as in it won't show up in practice), but mostly I'm not sure how to avoid duplicating the entire `positivity` extension. I know you can make a `positivity` extension trigger on different inputs, but the match inside would still only work for one of them. @hrmacbeth, do you have advice for me here?
I agree with Yael that this should be enough.
Could you look through the library and replace `ofReal_nonneg` and `ofReal_pos` with `positivity` where possible?

I just went along and tried that. There's basically no use of `zero_le_real`/`zero_lt_real` in mathlib and no use of `ofReal_ne_zero` that has `ComplexOrder` open (so `positivity` fails, since it needs a `PartialOrder` instance on every type). The solution to make this more applicable would be to have the `nonzeroness` tactic mentioned at @urkud's Rutgers talk.
My status is that I can't make it any better, but I would be very interested in learning how to fix the duplication between `Complex.ofReal'` and `Complex.ofReal`.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
